comment: if you want to be taught by random peoples videos and a textbook then take him. But he gives quizzes that have no relation to the tests and then ends up curving the tests because everyone fails.

Professor offered quizzes that were fairly easy to study for due to very in-depth study guides to follow along with lectures. Tests were more difficult to study for and sometimes the questions were a little confusing. He gave good information/ interesting articles for weekly readings. Not a time consuming class but still feel like I learned a lot.

Andrew Neiner does not seem like a professor who wants to do his job. He is inconsistent and unprofessional, and his class is poorly designed. The most effective way to succeed in this class is to use the textbook while taking quizzes and exams because there is no effective teaching. If you want to learn, take another professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Awful teacher. If it wasn't for the group chat everyone would be lost. Multiple times did we have to email him to look at our grade again because he mis-graded. For assignments you wont figure out what you got wrong or right so no way to study. He's confusing and may or may not reply back. I regret not dropping this class when I had the chance

First of all, this professor doesn't put any grades in until last minute... even with the entire class emailing him over and over. He grades hard and his tests are HARD. He is a horrible communicator and I have no idea what grade I have in his class, but I know that it shouldn't be this dang hard.

Easy class. Assignments are weekly but easy, but he doesn't post them at the same time weekly. 2 easy group assignments. does NOT respond to emails. grades easy. need to read the book to do well on test, but thats the only hardship. no papers.

I feel like Professor Neiner is barely familiar with D2L, an essential platform for online learners. He provides no flexibility in grading, and is non responsive. He posts assignments a few days before they are due. I felt on edge the entire semester because I didn't know what was due when because his calendar was unclear and often incorrect.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: This is going to sound weird, but I gave him a 2 because this class was too easy. I didn't study at all and did well on the exams. I was able to do all of the assignments the day they were due. He was extremely slow to grade and respond to emails. Take him for a GPA boost!

I really enjoyed this class! Some of the instructions for the group assignments were a little unclear but that was more on me. Really read the instructions! His tests aren't too terrible; a lot of the questions come almost verbatim from the tables and side notes in the book. Weekly assignments, a couple group assignments, and 34 tests.

This class is pretty average. There are new modules every week where you have to turn something in. Those assignments are pretty easy. The tests, however, are hard and on lock down browser. They are extremely detailed and he does not curve. He also is very responsive, but takes his time putting new material up.

You never know what grade you have.  Heavy homeworkk class and very hard tests.  We didn't get a curve like other posters said.  I studied and made c's on all tests.  This is a very difficult elective. Do NOT take.  Much easier electives.
THis is a heavy reading class with difficult exams.  The material is dry and the exams are maddening.  I wouldn't recommend this teaacher.  The final will determine if you pass or not

you have 4 tests that are extremely hard.  he has to curve them forr you to pass.  Their is a great deal of material to read every week and test questions are very picky items from the reading.  No time to look them up on tests.  If you don't have the readings completely memorized, you are in trouble.  Don't take.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He's an amazing professor very understanding and he will work with you if you show effort

If you need help, he is not willing to help you. I took his online course, and if you try to email him, good luck, because you won't get a response back - ever. I will not take him for another course.

This class was great. Very boring, but he did his best to make it interesting with video clips and activities. There were 10(i think) assignments (fairly easy) and 4 tests (hard, but he curves). Study a little and do the assignments and you should make an A.
Dr. Neiner knows his material and I learned a lot in his class. He is always willing to help and approachable if you have any issues.

One of the most boring classes ever!! But Dr. Niener was wonderful. He did everything he could to make the material more interesting, but the material is just cut and dry. Test and HW assignments were easy. Does not give study guides. Overall though  it's an Easy A.

The entire course is hardly more than a stats review class. Attendance not mandatory; I skipped more than I went. Assignments (1-2 pages) due about every week, but they are simple. He's nice and tests are easy. Definitely take if you need an easy A.
Very easy class if you pay attention.  Neiner is very nice and personable.

Awesome professor.  The material can be boring but if you do the work and put in some effort you can make an easy A.  Good class to take as an elective and Dr. Neiner is super nice and approachable.  4 multiple choice tests and a couple really easy 1 page reflection papers on an article he provides.  Pretty easy class and more fun than expected
Awesome psychology professor!  He definitely sets himself apart from the other psychology professors in regards to approachability. I highly recommend.

Don't take anyone else. Neiner is the man! I will be taking him next semester too for a different course. The material is boring at times but it's obvious Neiner puts in extra effort to make it as interesting as possible. He is very involved. One of my favorite professors at KSU so far.

I wouldn't take anyone else. The course material is boring, just straight up. But go to class, pay attention, do the assignments, and you'll do well. He is always looking for ways to help you out and really likes it when students participate in his class. Highly recommend. He loves this material and knows it well.
He is a nice guy and very willing to help. Down to earth and wants everyone to do well. Not overly boring or overly interesting. Don't stress if you have him.
TAKE HIM!  Midterm, final and project.

Professor Neiner seems like a great guy but is an awkward teacher. He's new so he's still trying to find the best methods. Vague in explaining things, but will clarify if you ask. Attendance taken almost every class and midterm and final are based from the book. He's an ok teacher.

I would not recommend Dr. Neiner's class to anyone. He is a nice guy and very knowledgeable about I/O psychology, but teaching doesn't appear to be his thing. He is very unorganized. The few PowerPoints he posted this semester were confusing and vague. I wish he were a better teacher because he seems like a great guy and his anecdotes are great.
